conclusion: Objects A and B are positioned on the left and right sides of the table.
Objects C and D are placed in the middle of the table.
Objects A and B move through the air and descend towards the table.
Because of gravity, objects A and B will make contact with the objects and the table surface.
As A and B descend, A will come into contact with object C, and B will come into contact with object D.
The forces exerted by gravity will cause A and B to rest on top of C and D, respectively.
After contact, A will be on top of C, and B will be on top of D.
The arrangement will look as shown in the second image, where A and B are draped over C and D, forming a tent-like structure.
Objects A and B will rest on top of objects C and D, creating a draped appearance over them.
